intro: Bicornella summerhayesiana, commonly known as the summerhayesian bicornellia, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Lamiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed flowers, which give it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
